contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Question and Answer | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Pat Metheny]], [[Dave Holland]], [[Roy Haynes]] | Cover = QuestionandAnsweralbumcover.png | Cover size = | Caption = | Released = 12 December 1989 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Jazz]] | Length = 62:36 | Label = [[Geffen Records|Geffen]] | Producer = [[Gil Goldstein]], [[Pat Metheny]], [[David Oakes]] | Compiled by = | Chronology = Pat Metheny | Last album = ''[[Letter from Home]]''<br />(1989) | This album = ''Question and Answer''<br />(1989) | Next album = ''Works''<br />(1991) | Misc = }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4.5|5}}<ref name="Allmusic"/> | rev2 = | rev2Score = }} '''''Question and Answer''''' is a 1989 music album release by [[modern jazz]] artists [[Pat Metheny]], [[Dave Holland]] and [[Roy Haynes]].<ref name="Allmusic">{{cite web |url= http://www.allmusic.com/album/r143833 |title=Question and Answer - Pat Metheny | AllMusic |first=Steven |last=McDonald |work=allmusic.com |year=2011 [last update] |accessdate=19 July 2011}}</ref> ==Track listing== # "[[Solar (composition)|Solar]]" ([[Miles Davis|Davis]]) – 8:27 # "Question and Answer" (Metheny) – 7:07 # "H&H" (Metheny) – 6:51 # "Never Too Far Away" (Metheny) – 5:52 # "Law Years" ([[Ornette Coleman|Coleman]]) – 6:51 # "Change of Heart" (Metheny) – 6:14 # "All the Things You Are" ([[Jerome Kern|Kern]], [[Oscar Hammerstein II|Hammerstein]]) – 8:26 # "Old Folks" (Hill, Robison) – 6:38 # "Three Flights Up" (Metheny) – 6:10 ==[[Billboard charts|Billboard album charts]]== {| border="1" ! Chart !! Peak !! Year |- | The Billboard 200 || 154 || 1990 |- | Top Jazz Albums || 3 || 1990 |} ==[[Grammy awards]]== {| border="1" ! Song !!
